urls.title: Flood wardens | Kent Prepared
urls.description: Flood wardens are volunteers trained to help and prepare people in local communities that are at risk of flooding. They play an important role in the preparing a community flood plan and putting it in to practice. They also provide a vital link between a local community and those responsible for responding to a flood. You will be the eyes and ears of the community and will help develop your local flood plan. You can choose to meet with other flood wardens in your community as often as you like, typically

tweets.text:

tweets.text:
Have you ever noticed that, during periods of heavy rainfall, we have less residential flooding in MK compared to other areas of the UK? üí¶

This is because of the network of balancing lakes, floodplains & SUDS which store excess water. 

Find out more üëá
https://t.co/fAmhFZh1GF https://t.co/2BhPo59r9D

urls.title: Tipping claims probe begins
urls.description: COUNCIL officials are investigating reports of new tipping taking place at a controversial Bromsgrove site.

tweets.text: The old ‚Äòdeveloping a golf course‚Äô ruse or put another way illegal dumping of waste. Surprised some still trying to get away with this. It‚Äôs a classic technique currently out of favour - too many golf courses üòâ. @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @pow_rebecca https://t.co/3LUeZqX8Gb

@FoxesAfloat Hi @FoxesAfloat, we're sorry to see this. We've been in contact with the local team this morning. They've confirmed that they will be visiting the site again today to assess the full extent of the pollution and what measures can be used to contain/remove the material. Thank you.

@edhw66 @JohnWright100 @Feargal_Sharkey @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW Thanks, so no requirement to clear up or does EA make a judgement and take on the work/cost if required? I think in the case I have shown above it‚Äôs considered a small breach as inert solids ie crushed concrete or stone. Hoped river will wash it through in time

incredible opportunity for a post doc role in our Green Recovery Team working with @ManMetUni & @WWTworldwide gathering evidence on #bluecarbon values of newly created #saltmarshes @DefraGovUK @HeritageFundUK @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland https://t.co/QnXStWNDzT closes 2nd Mar https://t.co/nWT02XybxI

tweets.text:
Works continue on the #Carlisle Flood Risk Management Scheme at Warwick Road Tesco store. 

We are working through Saturday & Sunday night this coming weekend to minimise disruption to the local community

Find out more here - https://t.co/gxCTOEbsAK https://t.co/EzgCXJZIx3
@FoxesAfloat @BikeAndBoatUK @CRTContactUs @CRTNorthWest @EnvAgency Get in touch with the RSPB as well as thd RSPCA and the local council got the area you're in that will start something going

@BikeAndBoatUK @CRTContactUs @CRTNorthWest @EnvAgency I am! The paintwork can be fixed but these poor geese and ducks are helpless. They're starting mating so splashing the water all over with the chasing. That's not healthy for them!

@FoxesAfloat @CRTContactUs @CRTNorthWest We've got it on the Grand Union too guys at Bridge 75. @CRTContactUs and @EnvAgency contacted yesterday and still no one on site. These two swans are caked. I'm livid as I guess you are. https://t.co/hLA6Qkut4V
